document_data.name: Dallnothax
document_data.mainbody: '''Dallnothax''' was one of three [[drow]] surface settlements in the [[Forest of Mir]].
document_data.Description: Dallnothax consisted of only a few small structures on the surface, which provided access to the caverns where the majority of the population lived. The buildings were protected by the cover of the trees and were primarily used to stable [[pony|ponies]]. The caverns were the upper sections of [[Ultosamrin]].
document_data.Geography:
Dallnothax was located in the northern foothills of the [[Marching Mountains]], north of the eastern tip of the range.

It was the northernmost of the three drow enclaves in the forest, the other two being [[Iskasshyoll]] and [[Holldaybim]]. The three settlements were interconnected by tunnels.<ref name=LoI1-T-pp53-54> Access to the [[Underdark]] at [[Guallidurth]] was intentionally sealed off by the surface drow.<ref name=LoI1-T-pp53-54 />
document_data.Government:
Unlike the drow of the [[Underdark]], the settlers of Dallnothax had a patriarchal society.

In {{Yearlink|1370}}, the leader of Dallnothax was [[Raaghar T'Enorgh]], a [[priest]] of [[Vhaeraun]] and a secret agent for the [[Twisted Rune]].
document_data.Defenses: Dallnothax maintained a force of guards who lived on the surface so that they could adapt to the sunlight. A new guard was selected every ten years.

Notable Locations.The [[Spider's Maw]]: A deep crevice located beneath the undercity of Dallnothax.

document_data.Inhabitants:
The settlement had a population in the hundreds to low thousands. Nearly three quarters of these worshiped the god Vhaeraun;<ref name=LoI1-T-pp53-54 /> the remainder worshiped even darker entities or rejected the gods altogether.<ref name=LoI1-T-pp53-54 /> Most were exiles or outcasts from drow society,<ref name=LoI1-T-pp53-54 /> cast out from the city of Guallidurth for their heretical beliefs.

One notable inhabitant was [[Tleobar T'Enorgh]], the patriarch's wife and a member of the surface guard, who had a vendetta against the [[Company of Eight]].
document_data.History:
The caverns making up the enclave once belonged to Ultosamrin, which belonged to [[Clan Velm]] of [[Deep Shanatar]]. The tunnels connecting the sister settlements were built during the time of the [[Night Wars]].

During the [[Eye Tyrant Wars]], warriors from Dallnothax briefly allied themselves with [[Calimshan|Calishite]] forces against the [[beholder]]s and their troops from the [[Alimir Hive]]. However, once the beholders were driven back, the drow and humans turned their attacks against each other.

Dallnothax's highest population seems to have been a few centuries before the fall of the [[Shoon Imperium]].<ref name=LoI1-T-pp53-54 /> Because the drow of Dallnothax were considered heretics for not worshiping [[Lolth]], the city of Guallidurth sought to eradicate them,<ref name=LoI1-T-pp53-54 /> beginning in the 1320s [[DR]].<ref name=LoI1-T-pp53-54 /> Every decade or so, Lolth's priestesses would start a crusade, attempt to pry open the sealed passages, and slaughter as many "heretics" as possible. A common target of the attacks was the Hall of Midnight Bloodshed, but this was in part by design of the Vhaeraun worshipers—the temple acted as a sort of decoy to keep the Lolth fanatics from attacking the true seat of power for Vhaeraun at the [[Vault of Cloaked Midnight]] under [[Mount Sarengard]]. Because of the frequent attacks, a minority of drow from Dallnothax and its sister enclaves considered allying with the [[beholder]]s of the [[Alimir Mountains]] and resettling in those caves.

In {{Yearlink|1346}}, exaggerated rumors of 80,000 drow living in the forest reached [[Tethyr]], and many soldiers from [[Ithal Pass]] to as far as [[Ithmong]]—and adventurers too—entered the forest to try and destroy the drow that they expected to find there. They found far fewer than they expected,<ref name=LoI1-T-pp53-54 /> but the [[human]] army and [[elves]] from the [[Forest of Tethir]] were able to annihilate a fourth sister enclave of [[Allshiwann]]. The [[Tethyrian Interregnum]] period allow the enclave to recover from any population losses caused by these attacks from humans and elves. A much larger threat to Dallnothax's existence was actually raids from [[ogre]]s in the forest.<ref name=LoI1-T-pp53-54 />
